alert.note: Alert for Cotton; Jefferson (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued February 26 at 9:05PM CST until February 26 at 9:45PM CST by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 930 PM CST FOR SOUTHEASTERN COMANCHE...NORTHWESTERN JEFFERSON...NORTHWESTERN GARVIN...GRADY...EAST CENTRAL CADDO...SOUTHERN OKLAHOMA...STEPHENS... EASTERN COTTON...WESTERN CLEVELAND...SOUTHEASTERN CANADIAN...MCCLAIN AND NORTH CENTRAL CLAY COUNTIES... At 905 PM CST, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Tuttle to 3 miles north of Alex to 10 miles northwest of Duncan to 5 miles east of Randlett, moving east at 60 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... Oklahoma City, Norman, Moore, Midwest City, Duncan, Del City, Chickasha, Newcastle, Blanchard, Purcell, Marlow, Walters, Waurika, Yukon, Bethany, Mustang, Choctaw, Warr Acres, Noble and Tuttle. TORNADO...POSSIBLE THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: Remain alert for a possible tornado! Tornadoes can develop quickly from severe thunderstorms. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Prepare immediately for large hail and damaging winds. People outside should move to a shelter, inside a strong building and away from windows. Intense thunderstorm lines can produce brief tornadoes and widespread significant wind damage. Although a tornado is not immediately likely, it is best to move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. These storms may cause serious injury and significant property damage.
